id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.

*See also: [WiFi Component](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#configuration-variables)*

bssid.docs:
**string**: The connection’s BSSID (MAC address). BSSIDs must consist of six two-digit hexadecimal values separated by colon characters (”`:`”). All letters must be in upper case.

*See also: [Connecting to Multiple Networks](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#connecting-to-multiple-networks)*

hidden.docs:
**boolean**: Whether this network is hidden. Defaults to false. If you add this option you also have to specify ssid.

*See also: [Connecting to Multiple Networks](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#connecting-to-multiple-networks)*

priority.docs:
**float**: The priority of this network. After each time, the network with the highest priority is chosen. If the connection fails, the priority is decreased by one. Defaults to `0`.

*See also: [Connecting to Multiple Networks](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#connecting-to-multiple-networks)*

networks.docs:
Configure multiple WiFi networks to connect to, the best one that is reachable will be connected to. See [Connecting to Multiple Networks](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#wifi-networks).

*See also: [WiFi Component](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#configuration-variables)*

ssid.docs:
**string**: The name (or [service set identifier](https://www.lifewire.com/definition-of-service-set-identifier-816547)) of the WiFi access point your device should connect to.

*See also: [WiFi Component](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#configuration-variables)*

password.docs:
**string**: The password (or PSK) for your WiFi network. Leave empty for no password.

*See also: [WiFi Component](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#configuration-variables)*

manual_ip.docs:
Manually configure the static IP of the node.
  * **static_ip** (**Required**, IPv4 address): The static IP of your node.
  
  * **gateway** (**Required**, IPv4 address): The gateway of the local network.
  
  * **subnet** (**Required**, IPv4 address): The subnet of the local network.
  
  * **dns1** (*Optional*, IPv4 address): The main DNS server to use.
  
  * **dns2** (*Optional*, IPv4 address): The backup DNS server to use.
  
  

*See also: [WiFi Component](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#configuration-variables)*

ap.docs:
Enable an access point mode on the node.
  * **ssid** (*Optional*, string): The name of the access point to create. Leave empty to use the device name.
  
  * **password** (*Optional*, string): The password for the access point. Leave empty for no password.
  
  * **channel** (*Optional*, int): The channel the AP should operate on from 1 to 14. Defaults to 1.
  
  * **manual_ip** (*Optional*): Manually set the IP options for the AP. Same options as manual_ip for station mode.
  
  * **ap_timeout** (*Optional*, [Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)): The time after which to enable the configured fallback hotspot. Defaults to `1min`.
  
  

*See also: [WiFi Component](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#configuration-variables)*

domain.docs:
**string**: Set the domain of the node hostname used for uploading. For example, if it’s set to `.local`, all uploads will be sent to `<HOSTNAME>.local`. Defaults to `.local`.

*See also: [WiFi Component](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#configuration-variables)*

reboot_timeout.docs:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The amount of time to wait before rebooting when no WiFi connection exists. Can be disabled by setting this to `0s`, but note that the low level IP stack currently seems to have issues with WiFi where a full reboot is required to get the interface back working. Defaults to `15min`.

*See also: [WiFi Component](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#configuration-variables)*

power_save_mode.docs:
**string**: The power save mode for the WiFi interface. See [Power Save Mode](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#wifi-power-save-mode)

*See also: [WiFi Component](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#configuration-variables)*

fast_connect.docs:
**boolean**: If enabled, directly connects to WiFi network without doing a full scan first. This is required for hidden networks and can significantly improve connection times. Defaults to `off`. The downside is that this option connects to the first network the ESP sees, even if that network is very far away and better ones are available.

*See also: [WiFi Component](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#configuration-variables)*

use_address.docs:
**string**: Manually override what address to use to connect to the ESP. Defaults to auto-generated value. Example, if you have changed your static IP and want to flash OTA to the previously configured IP address.

*See also: [WiFi Component](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#configuration-variables)*

output_power.docs:
**string**: The amount of TX power for the WiFi interface from 8.5dB to 20.5dB. Default for ESP8266 is 20dB, 20.5dB might cause unexpected restarts.

*See also: [WiFi Component](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#configuration-variables)*

enable_btm.docs:
**bool**: Only on `esp32` with `esp-idf`. Enable 802.11v BSS Transition Management support.

*See also: [WiFi Component](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#configuration-variables)*

enable_rrm.docs:
**bool**: Only on `esp32` with `esp-idf`. Enable 802.11k Radio Resource Management support.

*See also: [WiFi Component](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#configuration-variables)*

passive_scan.docs:
**boolean**: If enabled, then the device will perform WiFi scans in a passive fashion. Defaults to `false`.

*See also: [WiFi Component](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#configuration-variables)*

enable_on_boot.docs:
**boolean**: If enabled, the WiFi interface will be enabled on boot. Defaults to `true`.

*See also: [WiFi Component](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#configuration-variables)*

dns1.docs:
**IPv4 address**: The main DNS server to use.

*See also: [Connecting to Multiple Networks](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#connecting-to-multiple-networks)*

dns2.docs:
**IPv4 address**: The backup DNS server to use.

*See also: [Connecting to Multiple Networks](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#connecting-to-multiple-networks)*

static_ip.docs:
**IPv4 address**: The static IP of your node.

*See also: [Connecting to Multiple Networks](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#connecting-to-multiple-networks)*

gateway.docs:
**IPv4 address**: The gateway of the local network.

*See also: [Connecting to Multiple Networks](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#connecting-to-multiple-networks)*

subnet.docs:
**IPv4 address**: The subnet of the local network.

*See also: [Connecting to Multiple Networks](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#connecting-to-multiple-networks)*

identity.docs:
**string**: The outer identity to pass to the EAP authentication server. This is required for EAP-TLS.

*See also: [Enterprise Authentication](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#enterprise-authentication)*

username.docs:
**string**: The username to present to the authenticating server.

*See also: [Enterprise Authentication](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#enterprise-authentication)*

password.docs:
**string**: The password to present to the authentication server. For EAP-TLS this password may be set to decrypt to private key instead.

*See also: [Enterprise Authentication](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#enterprise-authentication)*

certificate_authority.docs:
**string**: Path to a PEM encoded certificate to use when validating the authentication server.

*See also: [Enterprise Authentication](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#enterprise-authentication)*

certificate.docs:
**string**: Path to a PEM encoded certificate to use for EAP-TLS authentication.

*See also: [Enterprise Authentication](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#enterprise-authentication)*

key.docs:
**string**: Path to a PEM encoded private key matching `certificate` for EAP-TLS authentication. Optionally encrypted with `password`.

*See also: [Enterprise Authentication](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#enterprise-authentication)*

ssid.docs:
**string**: The SSID or WiFi network name.

*See also: [Connecting to Multiple Networks](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#connecting-to-multiple-networks)*

password.docs:
**string**: The password to use for authentication. Leave empty for no password.

*See also: [Connecting to Multiple Networks](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#connecting-to-multiple-networks)*

channel.docs:
**int**: The channel of the network (1-14). If given, only connects to networks that are on this channel.

*See also: [Connecting to Multiple Networks](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#connecting-to-multiple-networks)*

manual_ip.docs:
Manually configure the static IP of the node when using this network. Note that when using different static IP addresses on each network, it is required to set `use_address`, as ESPHome cannot infer to which network the node is connected.
  * **static_ip** (**Required**, IPv4 address): The static IP of your node.
  
  * **gateway** (**Required**, IPv4 address): The gateway of the local network.
  
  * **subnet** (**Required**, IPv4 address): The subnet of the local network.
  
  * **dns1** (*Optional*, IPv4 address): The main DNS server to use.
  
  * **dns2** (*Optional*, IPv4 address): The backup DNS server to use.
  
  

*See also: [Connecting to Multiple Networks](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#connecting-to-multiple-networks)*

enable.docs:
This action turns on the WiFi interface on demand.

*See also: [`wifi.enable` Action](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#wifi-enable-action)*

disable.docs:
This action turns off the WiFi interface on demand.

*See also: [`wifi.disable` Action](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#wifi-disable-action)*

connected.docs:
This [Condition](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-condition) checks if the WiFi client is currently connected to a station.

*See also: [`wifi.connected` Condition](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#wifi-connected-condition)*

enabled.docs:
This [Condition](https://esphome.io/guides/automations.html#config-condition) checks if WiFi is currently enabled or not.

*See also: [`wifi.enabled` Condition](https://esphome.io/components/wifi.html#wifi-enabled-condition)*
